name: C# Backend Development for Dynamic Applications
topics: Building RESTful APIs with ASP.NET Core
Security Best Practices for C# Applications
Deploying C# Applications on Cloud Platforms

beginner.question: What is the main purpose of the .NET Framework in C# development?
options: To provide a platform for running C# applications
To offer a set of tools for designing user interfaces
To manage databases in C# applications
To compile C# code into machine language
beginner.hint: It's a platform that supports running C# applications.

beginner.question: Which of the following is a fundamental concept of Object-Oriented Programming in C#?
beginner.hint: This concept allows new classes to inherit properties from existing ones.

beginner.question: What is the primary use of ASP.NET Core in C# development?
beginner.hint: It's used for building web services like RESTful APIs.

beginner.question: Which library is commonly used for database integration in C# applications?
beginner.hint: It's an ORM framework for C#.

beginner.question: Why is asynchronous programming important in C#?
options: It helps in writing cleaner code
It allows programs to run multiple tasks simultaneously
beginner.hint: This type of programming helps in managing multiple tasks at the same time.

intermediate.question: Which of the following is a key feature of the .NET Framework that supports C# development?
intermediate.hint: This feature helps in automatic memory management.

intermediate.question: In C#, how do you define a class that implements an interface?
intermediate.hint: Use a colon to implement an interface.

intermediate.question: Which ASP.NET Core feature is essential for building RESTful APIs?
intermediate.hint: This feature allows handling HTTP requests and responses.

intermediate.question: What is the primary purpose of using Entity Framework in a C# application?
options: To map objects to database tables
intermediate.hint: Entity Framework deals with database operations.

intermediate.question: In C#, what keyword is used to indicate that a method will run asynchronously?
intermediate.hint: This keyword is used in the method signature.

advanced.question: What is the primary function of the Common Language Runtime (CLR) in the .NET Framework?
options: To compile C# code into machine code
To manage memory and execute .NET programs
To provide a graphical interface for development
To integrate third-party libraries into C# projects
advanced.hint: The CLR handles memory management and execution of code.

advanced.question: In C#, which of the following keywords is used to define an asynchronous method?
advanced.hint: This keyword is placed before the method's return type.

advanced.question: Which design pattern is commonly used to handle database changes in Entity Framework?
advanced.hint: This pattern is used to abstract the logic for accessing data.

advanced.question: When deploying a C# application to a cloud platform, which of the following factors is least important to consider?
options: CPU architecture of the cloud servers
advanced.hint: Cloud platforms often abstract hardware specifics from the developers.

advanced.question: In ASP.NET Core, which attribute would you use to secure a controller action so that only authenticated users can access it?
advanced.hint: This attribute ensures that only authenticated users can access the resource.
